title.narrative: 1.14 NUTRITION CAPACITY DEVELOPMENT

description.narrative: Public duty bearers with strengthened capacity are delivering quality integrated health and nutrition services in communities and facilities reached by the most disadvantaged mothers and children., which contributes to Community-Based Management Of Acute Malnutrition, Infant And Young Child Feeding, Micronutrients, Nutrition And Emergencies, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2017, the most disadvantaged children and women are accessing an integrated package of high impact, good quality health and nutrition services.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL PROGRAMME FOR FP AND PHC

sector.narrative: Breastfeeding protection, promotion and support (including work on Code)
Technical assistance - Treatment of severe acute malnutrition

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Public duty bearers with strengthened capacity are delivering quality integrated health and nutrition services in communities andfacilities reached by the most disadvantaged mothers and children.

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the government to build the capacity of around 9,000 healthcare providers on CMAM-IYCF, breastfeeding, BMS code, NIE, and stunting prevention module resulting in delivering quality integrated nutrition services in 1322 facilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:27/12/2017

title.narrative: Health facilities that provide SAM treatment services

actual.value: 2017:1,322 health facilities provide SAM treatment services throughout country.41 nutrition sites for SAM & IYCF are established in KP, 147 in Balochistan, 322 in Sindh and 812 in Punjab. As part of an emergency response, 23 OTP sites (11 in Tharparkar, 12 in Umerkot) provided SAM treatment services

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Community health workers trained with UNICEF support to provide infant and young child feeding counselling services in the reporting year

actual.value: 2017:About 7,920 community outreach workers (Males: 5227; Females: 2693) were trained on CMAM-IYCF for the provision of services in KP, FATA, Balochistan and Sindh. 39 Master Trainers (Males: 32; Females: 7) were trained on Stunting Prevention Module in Sindh. Master Trainers started cascade trainings
